newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices fall on less state buying.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices fall on less state buying.

text.p: Indian cotton prices fell on Wednesday on low mill buying and reduced purchases by state-owned agencies who were instead selling, dealers said.
"Earlier these agencies were buying but now they have begun selling cotton in the market," one broker said.
In spot deals Bengal-deshi slid by 20 rupees to 820/865 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned moved down by 5/20 rupees to 1,410/1,630 rupees.
Gujarat cotton on the other hand held steady in a narrow price band amid limited activity.
